bill_title: to reduce the voting requirements of the board of adjustment and to increase the minimum number of members appointed to the planning and zoning commission.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to reduce the voting requirements of the board of adjustment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 11-2-25.1 be amended to read as follows: 11-2-25.1. The board of county commissioners may provide for the appointment of appoint the planning and zoning commission to serve as a board of adjustment , and in the regulations and controls adopted pursuant to this chapter may provide that the said . The board of adjustment may , in specific cases , in order that to avoid unwarranted hardship , which constitutes an unreasonable deprivation of use as distinguished from the mere grant of a privilege, may be avoided, make, make upon an affirmative vote of three-fourths three-fifths of the full membership of the board of adjustment, special exceptions , or grant variances to the terms of the regulations or controls, subject to appropriate conditions or safeguards being adopted by the board of county commissioners. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to reduce the voting requirements of the board of adjustment and to increase the minimum number of members appointed to the planning and zoning commission. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 11-2-25.1 be amended to read as follows: 11-2-25.1. The board of county commissioners may provide for the appointment of appoint the planning and zoning commission to serve as a board of adjustment , and in the regulations and controls adopted pursuant to this chapter may provide that the said . The board of adjustment may , in specific cases , in order that to avoid unwarranted hardship , which constitutes an unreasonable deprivation of use as distinguished from the mere grant of a privilege, may be avoided, make, make upon an affirmative vote of three-fourths two-thirds of the full membership of the board of adjustment, special exceptions , or grant variances to the terms of the regulations or controls, subject to appropriate conditions or safeguards being adopted by the board of county commissioners. Section 2. That § 11-2-2 be amended to read as follows: 11-2-2. For the purpose of promoting health, safety, morals , and the general welfare of the county, the board of county commissioners of each county in the state, shall appoint a commission of three five or more members, the total membership of which shall always be an uneven number and at least one member of which shall be a member of the board, to be known as the county planning commission. Such commission shall also be the county zoning commission. BILL HISTORY 1/24/97 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 114 2/4/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/97 Deferred to another day. H.J. 290 2/6/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/6/97 Deferred to another day. H.J. 337 2/11/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/13/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/13/97 Local Government Do Pass Amended, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 475 2/13/97 Local Government Title Amended.
